definition: to use fully/to put to use
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: At three-fifteen the following afternoon, Persky worked his wizardry again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天下午三點十五分，帕斯基再次施展魔法。

sentences.english: He must exert himself to subdue so proud a display of resentment .
sentences.chinese: 他必須施展本事，征服這種因忌恨而產生的驕傲。

sentences.english: Gatemaster 2000 Casts Master rank Town Portal 1x per day.
sentences.chinese: 神行太保2000每天可施展1次時空之門。

sentences.english: Spring is working it's magic on the woodland floor, spreading a carpet of bluebells.
sentences.chinese: 春天在林地上施展魔法，灑滿一地的風鈴草。
雙方都施展出高超的球藝。

sentences.english: In order to win the game he called on all his skill.
sentences.chinese: 爲了打贏這場比賽，他施展出了全部招數。

sentences.english: The job gives my talents and abilities a full scope.
sentences.chinese: 這個工作給我提供了施展自身才能的廣闊天地。

sentences.english: The hired orators continued to pour forth their streams of eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 那些僱來的演說家繼續滔滔不絕地施展辯才。

sentences.english: Anti-ageing cream simply won't just do magic to them.
sentences.chinese: 抗衰老面霜不會輕而易舉的地對他們施展魔法。

sentences.english: Fielding was not ashamed to practise a little necromancy.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾丁不知羞恥地施展小巫術。

sentences.english: I gave him a chance to show his abilities yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天給了他一個施展才能的機會。

sentences.english: Beholder mages do not require material components to cast their spells.
sentences.chinese: 眼魔法師不需要材料成分就能施展它們的法術。

sentences.english: Imperialistic aggressors always use gunboat diplomacy to invade countries.
sentences.chinese: 帝國主義侵略者總是向被侵略國施展他們的炮艦外交。

sentences.english: The catacombs exert a morbid fascination over the citizens of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 地下墓穴對巴黎市民施展了一種病態的魔力。

sentences.english: They diplomatized in order to win victory.
sentences.chinese: 他們施展手腕，旨在取得勝利。

sentences.english: Gongsun Long told his new disciple to prove his talent.
sentences.chinese: 公孫龍着令新弟子施展其技。

definition: to fire/to discharge/to release (fireworks, smokescreen, poison gas, virus etc)
to implement the law/to perform sorcery
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
